Breathing Numbers: Mapping Air Pollution and Population Exposure in Italy

Air pollution is a major environmental issue, affecting public health and ecosystems, especially in urban and industrial areas. In Italy, pollutants like nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) and particulate matter (PM₁₀, PM₂.₅) often exceed safety limits, particularly in the Po Valley and major cities. These high pollutant levels contribute to health problems like respirator and lower quality of life.

This Web-GIS project offers a spatial analysis of air quality across Italy, using QGIS, Geo-Server, and OpenLayers. The platform lets users visualize and interact with real-time pollution data through dynamic maps, complete with features like dynamic legends and layer switchers. The aim is to support decision-making, raise public awareness, and improve environmental monitoring and policy.
